content.text:
The PRESIDING OFFICER. Pursuant to rule XXII, the Chair lays before 
the Senate the pending cloture motion, which the clerk will state.
content.speaker: The PRESIDING OFFICER

content.text:
The senior assistant legislative clerk read as follows:

                             Cloture Motion

       We, the undersigned Senators, in accordance with the 
     provisions of rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate, 
     do hereby move to bring to a close debate on the nomination 
     of Allison H. Eid, of Colorado, to be United States Circuit 
     Judge for the Tenth Circuit.
         Mitch McConnell, Steve Daines, Tom Cotton, Pat Roberts, 
           John Boozman, Mike Rounds, Patrick J. Toomey, John 
           Barrasso, Cory Gardner, Richard Burr, Thom Tillis, 
           Roger F. Wicker, James E. Risch, John Cornyn, Lamar 
           Alexander, Dan Sullivan, Chuck Grassley.
content.speaker: The RECORDER

content.text:
The PRESIDING OFFICER. By unanimous consent, the mandatory quorum 
call has been waived.
  The question is, Is it the sense of the Senate that debate on the 
nomination of Allison H. Eid, of Colorado, to be United States Circuit 
Judge for the Tenth Circuit, shall be brought to a close?
  The yeas and nays are mandatory under the rule.
  The clerk will call the roll.
  The senior assistant legislative clerk called the roll.
content.speaker: The PRESIDING OFFICER

content.text:
Mr. DURBIN. I annouce that the Senator from Missouri (Mrs. McCaskill) 
and the Senator from New Jersey (Mr. Menendez) are necessarily absent.
content.speaker: Mr. DURBIN

content.text:
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Sullivan). Are there any other Senators in 
the Chamber desiring to vote?
content.speaker: The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Sullivan)

content.text:
The yeas and nays resulted--yeas 56, nays 42, as follows:

                      [Rollcall Vote No. 258 Ex.]
content.speaker: The RECORDER

content.text:
The PRESIDING OFFICER. On this vote, the yeas are 56, the nays are 
42.
  The motion is agreed to.
content.speaker: The PRESIDING OFFICER
